arm_group.description: Subjects will consume tablets containing no potassium in addition to a basal diet containing 2336 mg potassium
Subjects will consume 720 mg potassium in the form of potassium gluconate tablets daily in addition to a basal diet containing 2336 mg potassium
Subjects will consume 1440 mg potassium in the form of potassium gluconate tablets daily in addition to a basal diet containing 2336 mg potassium
Subjects will consume 2160 mg potassium in the form of potassium gluconate tablets daily in addition to a basal diet containing 2336 mg potassium
Subjects will consume 720 mg potassium in the form of potato daily in addition to a basal diet containing 2336 mg potassium
Subjects will consume 1440 mg potassium in the form of potato daily in addition to a basal diet containing 2336 mg potassium
Subjects will consume 2160 mg potassium in the form of potato daily in addition to a basal diet containing 2336 mg potassium
Subjects will consume 2160 mg potassium in the form of french fries daily in addition to a basal diet containing 2336 mg potassium
Subjects will consume a basal diet containing 2336 mg potassium daily

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is designed to compare the effect of sources of potassium on uptake and the
      effect of potassium on blood pressure.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bioavailability of Potassium From Potatoes and Potassium Gluconate

detailed_description.textblock:
The study will compare uptake of potassium from three different doses and sources;
      supplements (720, 1440 and 2160 mg) potatoes (720, 1440 and 2160 mg) or French fries (2160
      mg).

      During 9 phases, participants will consume a controlled diet with the supplements, potato or
      french fries (every other week for 5 days). On the 4th day, blood and urine samples will be
      taken to monitor potassium uptake and excretion.  Measures of blood pressure will be
      analyzed at defined time points throughout the intervention.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Able to adhere to the visit schedule, protocol requirements and available to
             complete the study

          -  Normotensive men and women

          -  Aged 20-60 years

          -  BMI of 15-35

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Medication to treat hypertension or hypotension

          -  Medication known to affect electrolyte metabolism or contain high levels of potassium
             or sodium

          -  smoke cigarettes or use illegal drugs

          -  Hypertension or hypotension

          -  Diseases known to affect potassium metabolism

          -  Pregnant

          -  Allergic to nuts

clinical_study.official_title: Bioavailability of Potassium From Potatoes and Potassium Gluconate

primary_outcome.description: After 4 days of acclimation to the supplementation, absorption of potassium will be measured.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Differences in blood pressure will be measured between levels of potassium consumption.

collaborator.agency: Alliance for Potato Research and Education (APRE)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Bio-availability Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject)
